data.question: Choose the option that best completes the gap, I'll find time for my _________ when I get _________with this difficult assignment.
data.solution: Pastime implies an activity that someone does regularly for enjoyment rather than work , while get through implies to pass a difficult experience

data.question: After so many trials, the experiment __________
data.solution: Paid off means to become worthwhile or to produce a benefit.

data.question: Choose the option that best completes the gap. The chairman refused to shake __________ with the secretary
data.solution: When you shake hands with someone you take their right hand in your own for a few moments, often moving it up and down slightly

data.question: Choose the option that best completes the gap. Wherever the leader went people struggled to catch a __________ of him
data.solution: To catch a glimpse of someone or something means to briefly look at someone or to briefly see the person or thing. The verb ‘catch’ cannot be used with ‘look’ in option B, ‘view’ in option C and ‘picture’ in option D.

data.question: Choose the option that best completes the gap. Mrs. Okoro __________ in this school since 1975
data.solution: Since' implies from a specified time in the past. A present perfect progressive tense describes an event in a progressive form that started in the past and ended in the present. 'has been teaching' is an example of a verb element associated with a present perfect progressive tense

data.question: Choose the option that best completes the gap.  I was seriously disappointed when the __________ between the two teams ended in a goalless draw
data.solution: A match means a competitive sport event between two teams

data.question: Choose the option that best completes the gap. The young man looked carefully at the long document, but he couldn't make __________ what it meant
data.solution: To make out;  means to understand something. Simply put, he couldn't understand what it meant.

data.question: Choose the option that best completes the gap. While the worshippers closed their eyes in prayer, a thief made __________ with the collection
data.solution: Made away means to steal or abduct

data.question:
Choose the option that best completes the gap.

If you keep playing with this door handle, it will get __________
data.solution:
Loose means something that is not firmly or tightly fixed in place; detached or able to be detached.

Loosed can function as the past tense and past participle for loose.

data.question: <u>For all he cared: the game was as good as lost</u>

option.a: He did not care if the game as lost
option.b: He could not care less if the game was lost
option.c: He was almost certain that the game would be lost
option.d: He was afraid the game would be lost

data.section: Choose the option nearest in meaning to the underlined.
data.solution:
For all I care' is used to say that a person is not worried/ uninterested about what happened to someone or something. 'As good as' indicates a comparison between 'the game' and 'a lost'

Option C is the best answer

data.question: The meeting was <u>cancelled</u> because of the convocation
data.section: Choose the option nearest in meaning to the underlined.
data.solution:
To cancel implies to decide/ announce that an event will not take place.

Call off means to decide that something will not happen

data.question: Ayodeji is an <u>ardent</u> supporter of education for the child
data.section: Choose the option nearest in meaning to the underlined.
data.solution: Ardent means very passionate and enthusiastic

data.question: The <u>exhibition</u> was an eye-opener to all
data.section: Choose the option nearest in meaning to the underlined.
data.solution: Exhibition means a public display of woks of art or items of interest

data.question: As a Journalist, Bola has always had a <u>nose</u> for stories
data.section: Choose the option nearest in meaning to the underlined.
data.solution: To have a nose for something means to have an instinct or a natural ability to find recognize something

data.question: Nwankwo was on the <u>verge</u> of signing a two-year contract with the club
data.section: Choose the option nearest in meaning to the underlined.
data.solution:
To be on the verge of something means to be very close to it.

To be on the brink also means to be on the edge or border of something.

data.question: The Governor told the chief that he was only on a <u>routine</u> tour
data.section: Choose the option nearest in meaning to the underlined.
data.solution: Routine means performed as part of a regular procedure

data.question: The new ruler is <u>big-hearted</u> in his dealing with the people
data.section: Choose the option nearest in meaning to the underlined.
data.solution: Big-hearted means kind and generous

data.question: The essay topic is <u>nebulous</u>
data.section: Choose the option nearest in meaning to the underlined.
data.solution: Nebulous means vague or unclear

data.question: The events of last Friday show that there is no love lost between the Principal and the Vice-principal
data.section: Choose the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.
data.solution: The term no love lost signifies ill will exclusively. If there is no love lost between two people, they have a strong enmity towards or hate for the other and make no effort to conceal it.

data.question: If he were here, it could be more fun

option.a: He did not show up and so the occasion lacked much fun
option.b: He was being expected to supply more fun
option.c: There was no fun because he was not present
option.d: He was expected but did not show up to liven up the occasion

data.section: Choose the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.
data.solution:
The first clause 'if he were here' reveals an unreal conditional statement that signifies the absence of someone. However the second clause 'it could be more fun'  signifies the presence of little fun.

Option A is the best answer

data.question: Choose the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence. Adawo is an Imp
data.section: Choose the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.
data.solution:
An imp is a person with mischievous behaviour.

Option D is the correct answer.

data.question: The man reasoned that there ought to be a limit to sycophancy

option.a: there can be no favour beyond a reasonable point
option.b: sycophants need not talk all the time
option.c: people should know when not to use flattery
option.d: sycophants should know when to grant people requests

data.section: Choose the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.
data.solution:
sycophancy;  using of flattery compliments to gain self-serving favour or advantage from another person.

Option C is correct. 
''The man reasoned that there ought to be a limit to sycophancy'' means that, they should be a limit to how people use flattery compliments on people especially when they stand to gain something in return.

data.question: The organization is constantly in a state of flux

option.a: There are periodic changes in the organization
option.b: The organization is facing a difficult period
option.c: The organization is experiencing; good times

data.section: Choose the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.
data.solution: A state of flux means a state of uncertainty about what should be done usually followed by the establishment of a new direction of action, Flux is used to describe something that constantly changes

data.question: The witness averred that she had seen Dosun at the scene of the crime
data.section: Choose the option opposite in meaning to the word(s) or phrase in italics.
data.solution:
To aver means to establish a fact or assert a truth.

To deny means to disprove of a statement. It is the opposite of ‘aver’.

data.question: The governor's visit is an unprecedented event in the history of the social club
data.section: Choose the option opposite in meaning to the word(s) or phrase in italics.
data.solution:
unprecedented; means something that has never done or known before.
Something that is remarkable.

Option C ''Insignificant'' is the correct option. It means simply means something that is meaningless; too small or unimportant to be worth consideration.

data.question: Our principal took exception to the ignoble role the teacher played in the matter
data.section: Choose the option opposite in meaning to the word(s) or phrase in italics.
data.solution: ignoble implies not honourable in character or purpose

data.question: He is notorious for his drunkenness
data.section: Choose the option opposite in meaning to the word(s) or phrase in italics.
data.solution:
Notorious means famous or well known for some bad qualities.

Renowned means famous for something for good qualities

data.question: The severity of the harmattan helped me to complete my writing assignment in record time because i had no choice but to lock myself indoors
data.section: Choose the option opposite in meaning to the word(s) or phrase in italics.
data.solution: severity is the state of being severe . the degree of something being bad or undesirable very great; intense. while the opposite of severity is mildness which means not severe; gentle.

data.question: This card entitles you to attend the film show
data.section: Choose the option opposite in meaning to the word(s) or phrase in italics.
data.solution:
‘Entitle’ means to qualify, allow or give someone the right to do something

‘Disqualify’ means to make one ineligible to do something.

data.question: He is loved for his altruism
data.section: Choose the option opposite in meaning to the word(s) or phrase in italics.
data.solution:
Altruism means to have regard for others at the expense of oneself.

Selfishness means to always consider one’s own interest before others.

data.question: The Journalist said he was working freelance
data.section: Choose the option opposite in meaning to the word(s) or phrase in italics.
data.solution:
To work freelance means to work randomly without having a long-term contract with any firm or person.

Dependent means to rely on a particular person or thing. It is the antonym of ‘freelance’ in this context.

data.question: The Flying Eagles put up a plucky defence against their opponents
data.section: Choose the option opposite in meaning to the word(s) or phrase in italics.
data.solution:
Plucky means showing courage in difficult situations.

Weak means lacking energy or force.

data.question: We found a shady place for the display
data.section: Choose the option opposite in meaning to the word(s) or phrase in italics.
data.solution: Shady means situated in or full of shade

data.question: The sea wave continue to ____________ the cliff on the west coast constantly
data.section: Choose the word(s) or phrase(s) which best fill(s) the gap.
data.solution: Erode means to gradually wear away or gradually disappear. Erode is used in a context that relates to wind, water or other natural agents.

data.question: I would have been surprised if you ____________ the orange
data.section: Choose the word(s) or phrase(s) which best fill(s) the gap.
data.solution: Would have' is used in conditional statements to talk about something that did not happen in the past. In the sequence of tenses, if the main clause contains 'would have', the conditional subordinate clause should be in its past participle.

data.question: By the time the plane reaches Harare, it __________in the air for twelve hours
data.section: Choose the word(s) or phrase(s) which best fill(s) the gap.
data.solution: By the time' is an adverb of time that can be used in the present, past and future tense. The question is, however, in the present tense which will be needing a present perfect tense to complete the sentence.

data.question: The patient is suffering from ____________
data.section: Choose the word(s) or phrase(s) which best fill(s) the gap.
data.solution: The options contain miss spellings of the word, RHEUMATISM.

data.question: We saw Ifueko ____________ an egg on the wall
data.section: Choose the word(s) or phrase(s) which best fill(s) the gap.
data.solution:
‘Smash’ is the correct answer because the action conveyed is a single action.

In reported statements, writers/ speakers should retain the present tense.

data.question: Knowledge of figures of speech as well as of idiom and lexical items ____________ in this section
data.section: Choose the word(s) or phrase(s) which best fill(s) the gap.
data.solution:
When either of these words is used; as well as, together with, alongside, no less than e.t.c, the subject of the clause would be the noun or pronoun that comes before the marker of accompaniment. 

Knowledge of figures of speech is a singular subject that should agree with a singular verb

data.question: The answers to the questions were discussed ____________ the students
data.section: Choose the word(s) or phrase(s) which best fill(s) the gap.
data.solution: By' is the best answer to this question. Between can not be considered because the question did not explicitly tell us the number of students involved.

data.question: The shipping company advertised for ____________ accountants

option.a: two young but highly competent Nigerian
option.b: young but highly competent two Nigerian
option.c: two Nigerian, young, but highly competent
option.d: highly competent, but young, two Nigerian

data.section: Choose the word(s) or phrase(s) which best fill(s) the gap.
data.solution: The shipping company advertised for two young, but highly competent Nigerian accountants

data.question: Choose the word(s) or phrase(s) which best fill(s) the gap. If it had rained, we would have had to postpone the concert. It didn't rain, so ____________
data.section: Choose the word(s) or phrase(s) which best fill(s) the gap.
data.solution: The conditional statement ended with the first sentence. The following statement should therefore end with a past tense

data.question: Now, I am used ____________ bread without butter
data.section: Choose the word(s) or phrase(s) which best fill(s) the gap.
data.solution:
eating is present participle. 
used is an adjective that qualiffied the verb eating. therefore it is is right to say ''to eating'' rightly fits into that statement
I am used to eating bread without butter.

data.question: Choose the option that has a different stress pattern from the others.
data.solution:
1. ability has its stress pattern on the second syllable

2. registration has its stress pattern on the third syllable

3. quadruplicate has its stress pattern on the second syllable

4. revivalist has its stress pattern on the second syllable

 

Registration, therefore, has a different stress pattern from the rest with its stress on the 2nd syllable

data.question: Choose the option that has a different stress pattern from the others.
data.solution: All the words are stressed on the first syllable except 'represent' which is stressed on the last syllable.

data.question: <u>th</u>atch
data.section: Choose the option that has the same consonant sound as the one represented by the letter(s) underlined.
data.solution: Method' has the same consonant sound as the letters underlined in the word 'thatch'

data.question: <u>ch</u>ateau
data.section: Choose the option that has the same consonant sound as the one represented by the letter(s) underlined.
data.solution:
chateau; /ˈʃatəʊ/

champagne; /ʃamˈpeɪn/

data.question: Choose the option that has the same consonant sound as the one represented by the letter(s) emboldened. Joint
data.solution:
Joint /dʒɔɪnt/

Advantage /əd.ˈvɑːn.tɪdʒ/

data.question: choose the option opposite in meaning to the word(s) in italics. The manager commended the players for the narrow victory.
data.solution: Narrow here means close or small margin.

data.question:
choose the option that best completes the gap(s).

I am not sure that all _____ well with John.
data.solution:
All is well is when it refers to everything.

The question, all is well is most appropriate because the context is used to refer to everything and not everyone in a group

data.question: choose the option nearest in meaning to the underlined. Thousands of students <u>are candidates</u> for the examination but only very few pass
data.solution: Enter for implies to partake, participate or take part in something

data.question: choose the option that best completes the gap(s). We look forward to _______ from you very soon.
data.solution: The expression ‘look forward to’ must be followed with a gerund.

data.question: choose the option nearest in meaning to the italicized words or expressions. The French classes were always funny because we considered French a strange tongue.
data.solution:
Strange means unfamiliar.

Foreign means originating from another country.

data.question: choose the option opposite in meaning to the word(s) in italics. Everyone testifies to the unique taste of our flavor.
Choose the option that best completes the gap. All God's prophets were given the great __________ to preach salvation to people
data.solution:
Commission means a task or mission to accomplish.

Take note of the double ‘s’ and the double ‘m’. All other options are wrongly spelt

data.question:
choose the option that best completes the gap(s).

The principal _________ our mobile phones.
data.solution:
Note the correct spelling of ‘seize’.

To seize a thing means to deliberately take hold of it for a period of time

data.question:
choose the word(s) or phrase(s) which best fill(s) the gap(s).

For fear of being caught, the thief shouted and cursed the slow bank manager in a language ________much for words.
data.solution: Here is an adverb of degree. The correct item to use is ‘too’.

data.question: choose the option nearest in meaning to the italicized words or expressions. The coach invited me to his office having found me mettlesome
data.solution: Mettlesome means to be courageous. The correct answer is A

data.question:
choose the option that best completes the gap(s).

You may now ___________ with your presentation.
data.solution: Note the spelling of each word.

data.question: choose the option opposite in meaning to the word(s) in italics. Father Francis thanked God for the abundance of blessings his family received
data.solution:
Abundance means an excessive availability of something.

Paucity means fewness in number

data.question: The pastor asked the women to _________ their hearts to God in prayers.
data.section: choose the word(s) or phrase(s) which best fill(s) the gap(s).
data.solution:
To bare one’s mind means to reveal or uncover all that is in it.

  Note the spelling.

data.question: We saw you earlier but we could not stop you because we did not know __________.
data.section: choose the word(s) or phrase(s) which best fill(s) the gap(s).
data.solution: The expression is in its past tense and should maintain a past tense all through

data.question: choose the option opposite in meaning to the word(s) in italics. It is customary to find young men and women in sports.
data.solution:
Customary means habitual or conventional.

Unusual means unlike what is expected.It is the antonym of ‘customary’

data.question: High mortality rate is becoming increasingly predominant.
data.section: choose the option nearest in meaning to the italicized words or expressions.
data.solution:
‘Predominant’ means common, significant and important.

‘Rampant’ means common and unrestrained.

data.question: The rapist claimed that the woman’s voluptuous hips attracted him
data.section: choose the option nearest in meaning to the italicized words or expressions.
data.solution: ‘Voluptuous’ means full and attractive.

data.question:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.

  Grandma told the boys a story that cheered them up.
data.solution:
To cheer one up means to make them happy especially after having been sad.

To be delighted means to be happy. The correct answer is C.

data.question:
choose the option that best completes the gap.

  The cliff is popularly known for ___________ morning beauty.
data.solution: ‘‘Its’’ is the correct possessive form.

data.question:
select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.

  The team adapted to the new tactic as clean as a whistle.

option.a: They adapted to the pattern perfectly
option.b: They needed a whistle to be able to adapt to the pattern.
option.c: They adapted to the tactic with little errors
option.d: They found it difficult to adapt to the new tactic.

data.solution: The expression ‘as clean as a whistle’ means perfectly and without errors.

data.question:
choose the option opposite in meaning to the word(s) in italics.

  The driver was discharged while the car owner was ___________ for fraud.
data.solution:
To discharge someone means to legally release them from confinement.

To remand means to be charged and awaiting trials.

data.question: choose the option nearest in meaning to the italicized words or expressions. The police later discovered that Audu feigned death.
data.solution:
To feign means to make a false show of something.

To fake something means to make a false display.
